        Verify that DERBY-887 is fixed.

      • test_legalBooleanCasts

        public void test_legalBooleanCasts()
                            throws java.lang.Exception

        Verify that the legal boolean casts work as expected. This test helps verify that DERBY-887 is fixed. Verifies the following:

        • Implicit casts of BOOLEAN to legal types.
        • Implicit casts of legal types to BOOLEAN.
        • Explicit casts of BOOLEAN to legal types.

        The following can't be tested until the BOOLEAN type is re-enabled:

        • Explicit casts of legal types to BOOLEAN.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test_illegalBooleanCasts

        public void test_illegalBooleanCasts()
                              throws java.lang.Exception

        Verify that the illegal boolean casts work as expected. This test helps verify that DERBY-887 is fixed. Verifies the following:

        • Implicit casts of BOOLEAN to illegal types.
        • Implicit casts of illegal types to BOOLEAN.
        • Explicit casts of BOOLEAN to illegal types.

        The following can't be tested until the BOOLEAN type is re-enabled:

        • Explicit casts of illegal types to BOOLEAN.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testDataTruncationWarning

        public void testDataTruncationWarning()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Test that a java.sql.DataTruncation warning is created when a cast results in truncation. DERBY-129.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkDataTruncationResult

        private void checkDataTruncationResult(java.sql.Statement s,
                                       java.lang.String sql)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException

        Check the results for the queries in testDataTruncation().

        The method expects a query that returns three rows with columns of a character string or binary string data type, where some of the values are cast to a narrower data type.

        Expect the following truncations to have taken place:

        1. Row 1, column 1: truncated from 3 to 2 bytes
        2. Row 3, column 1: truncated from 3 to 2 bytes
        3. Row 3, column 2: truncated from 4 to 2 bytes
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Description copied from class: BaseJDBCTestCase
        Tear down this fixture, sub-classes should call super.tearDown(). This cleans up and closes the connection if it is open and any statement objects returned through the utility methods.

      • suite

        public static junit.framework.Test suite()
        Create a test suite with all the tests in this class. Although we're testing embedded functionality, also run the test in client/server mode to ensure that warnings and errors travel across the wire.
